Author: Matija Marohnić
Message: Docs: Update and refactor release workflow recipe (#2498)

Author: Matija Marohnić
Message:
Docs: Remove recipe for using a config file

It seems too basic and obvious.

Author: Matija Marohnić
Message:
Docs: Remove recipe for splitting tasks in files

It should be very obvious that you can `require` functions from other
files in `gulpfile.js` and export them as tasks, it seems unnecessary to
use `gulp-hub`.

Author: Matija Marohnić
Message:
Docs: Remove recipe for specifying a CWD

The `cwd` option is described in the docs for `gulp.src`, and `--cwd`
can be found when running `gulp --help`. Having this as a recipe seems
unnecessary.

Author: Matija Marohnić
Message:
Docs: Remove recipe for running shell commands

gulp v4 supports this natively now, tasks can return a child process.

https://gulpjs.com/docs/en/getting-started/async-completion#returning-a-child-process

Author: Matija Marohnić
Message:
Docs: Remove recipe for exporting tasks

This is a core feature, it's not necessary to explain it in a recipe.

Author: Matija Marohnić
Message:
Docs: Remove recipe for running tasks in series

gulp v4 supports this natively, as explained in the recipe itself, so
there is no need for it.

Author: Matija Marohnić
Message:
Docs: Remove recipes for selecting changed files

gulp v4 supports this natively by combining `since` with
`gulp.lastRun()`.

https://gulpjs.com/docs/en/api/lastrun

Author: mako yass
Message:
correct gulp.task signature (#1653)

* correct gulp.task signature

`gulp.task(name [, deps, fn])` means that only `gulp.task(name, deps, fn)` and `gulp.task(name)` are allowed, which is apparently not the case and it's a bit confusing. The correct notation, `gulp.task(name [, deps] [, fn])`, also permits for `gulp.task(name, deps)`, and `gulp.task(name, fn)`.

* fixed indexing
